page.title: 10WHALTON'S SHOPS AND PUB.
page.content: Whalton villagers are lucky to still be served by two shops: {The Post Office/General Store}has been run by Mary and Sid Law for 32 years. As well as providing the post office service the shop also sells groceries, newspapers in fact a vast range of goods from paraffin to birthday cards. The shop acts as a centre of contact for the villagers. {The Butchers Shop is}run by Barras Robson who spends most of his time out with his mobile butchers van. The shop itself is normally open on Thurs. and Sat.and manned by 71 year old Marcus Chisholm who has worked there for 34 years. {The Beresford Arms}is now not so much a village pub as a smart eating house catering for visitors rather than locals. They serve bar and restaurant meals.
